meanings.definition: Diastereoisomers: Stereoisomers that are not mirror images of each other.
meanings.sent1: In organic chemistry, diastereoisomers have different spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study diastereoisomers to understand their unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The diastereoisomers decided to go their separate ways in the chemical reaction.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two diastereoisomers was like siblings who looked similar but had distinct personalities.
meanings.sent5: When looking at diastereoisomers, remember they are not mirror images, unlike twins.

meanings.definition: Diastereoisomers: Molecules with the same molecular formula and sequence of bonded atoms, but different spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent1: Chemists use advanced techniques to distinguish diastereoisomers based on their spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent2: Identifying diastereoisomers is crucial in drug development to ensure the right molecular structure.
meanings.sent3: The diastereoisomers threw a party, but each molecule stood in a unique corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The diastereoisomers danced around each other, like planets orbiting the sun in different paths.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing diastereoisomers is like rearranging furniture in a room to create a new layout.
